member.name: T:VC3.Diagnostics.PerformanceAuditor
member.summary:
The PerformanceAuditor provides time and iteration counting of audited areas of code. The PerformanceAuditor is all static thus can be simply dropped into problematic code to determine bottlenecks. The results of the performance monitoring will be calculated/summarized to the debug window by default or to a log file/folder if specified in the StartProcess method. The general idea is:
PerformanceAuditor.StartProcess("Bottleneck Testing"); //Initialize the PerformanceAuditor to begin tracking ... using (IDisposable activity = PerformanceAuditor.AuditActivity("My Activity Type", "Generally")) //Wrap the code you want to audit in using statements for the activity { ... using (IDisposable activity = PerformanceAuditor.AuditActivity("My Activity Type", "Specifically")) //Audited activities can be nested as many times as needed to give you a breakdown of a process { ... } ... } ... PerformanceAuditor.EndProcess(); //End the initial process which will cause all of the results to be output to the log

member.name: M:VC3.Diagnostics.PerformanceAuditor.StartProcess(System.String)
member.summary: Calling this method begins the process of performance auditing. The description is for informational purposes only in the log. The debug window will be used to output log messages.
member.param: String describing the performance auditing process. Only used in logging.

member.summary: Calling this method begins the process of performance auditing. The description is for informational purposes only in the log. A log file will be created at if it doesn't exist. If there is a file already at then the old file will be deleted.
member.param: String describing the performance auditing process. Only used in logging.
Path to log file. Should be a text file.

member.summary: Begins the process of performance auditing. The description is for informational purposes only in the log. The will be used to contain the log files which are timestamped.
member.param: String describing the performance auditing process. Only used in logging.
The folder in which the timestamped logs should be created. If the directory does not exist, it will be created.

member.name: T:VC3.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationManager
member.summary: Responsible for handling user authentication.
member.remarks: This class couples authentication, ticket and identity creation so that user classes that serve as principles can use an AuthenticatedIdentity as their identity. This ensures that identities are actually authenticated. In contrast, if a user class was to accept an IIdentity object, the identity could come from an untrusted source. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:VC3.Security.Authentication.LdapContext
member.summary: Represents an authentication context within an LDAP directory. Works in conjunction with an
member.remarks:
The context can operate in either an template mode or a search mode. In either case, the goal of the context is to convert a username into an LDAP distinguished name (DN). For example, a user may login with username "hooperma". However, to authenticate against the LDAP directory it must be converted to the DN "CN=hooperma,OU=VC3\, Inc - Corporate,DC=vc3,DC=com".
In template mode, a contextTemplate must be specified. This template is used to determine the distinguished names of any user authenticating in this context is determined by replacing the "{0}" in the string with a username entered by a user. An example template would be: LDAP://mustang/CN={0},OU=VC3\, Inc - Corporate,DC=vc3,DC=com
In search mode, the directory is search to determine DNs. The searchRoot attribute determines which portion of the LDAP directory is searched. The searchFilter attribute is used to match a particular user. The username entered by the user during login will replace the "{0}" in the searchFilter. The filter syntax is defined in RFC 2254 (http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2254.html). The searchScope attribute can be used to control how much of the directory can be specifed. Options are "base", "sub", and "one" (the default). searchUser and searchPassword can be specified if the search must be performed non-anonymously. In this case, the authenticator will bind using these credentials first and then search the directory.
Search mode is useful when authenticating against Active Directory. In AD users tend to have common names (CN) in the form "firstname lastname" unlike most other LDAP directories which use a username. In these cases, the directory can be searched, matching the sAMAccountName object property with the username entered. In other words the searchFilter would be: "(sAMAccountName={0})".

remarks.para: The returned profile will have the following values: username, firstname*, lastname*, emailaddress*, and all other attributes found in the context's config element (* indicates optional attribute). All attributes of the user in the LDAP directory will be available in the profile as ldap.<property>. For example, ldap.mail can be used to get the "mail" property.

Password to validate. Blank passwords are not allowed.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObject
member.summary: Abstract base class for objects representing the business layer in a three-tier architectural design.
member.remarks:
This common base class addresses common development issues by:
Facilitating a mechanism for tracking objects that have not be loaded and then performing on-demand bulk load procedures to load data efficiently
Providing a datasource agnostic approach that may be used for relational, xml, or other data that consists of objects and object relations through one to one, one to many, and many to many relationships.
Incorporating an attribute-based approach to property-level validation to support common types of business rules. See for more information.
Providing a consistent mechanism for committing complete object graphs in the appropriate sequence, including the ability to easily hook in transaction support.
The VC3 Modeler automates the creation of BusinessObject subclasses.

member.param: Object to compare with b
Object to compare with a
member.returns: True if they are considered equal. (See remarks)

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObject.Cache
member.summary: Provides per request caching services for business object subclasses.
member.remarks:
If the object is running the context of a web request, the will be an instance of , which delegates to the collection to provide a request-scoped cache.
If the object is running outside of a web request, an instance of will be used, which simply stores cached items in a , resulting in a thread-scoped cache that will never disapear for the life of the application.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObject.Identifier
member.summary: Represents the unique identifier for a instance.

remarks.para: Subclasses must override in order to expose the values the identifier represents, and in order to convert the identifier to a compact string representation.

An assumption is that there will be many instances of this class and that subclasses will be responsible for most of the implementation. Because of this, this class is as lightweight as possible and each instance has no memory footprint due to their being no fields delgating all storage responsibilities to subclasses.

The type of object stored in the cache

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.ICache`2.GetOrAdd(`0,VC3.ComponentModel.FactoryMethod{`1,`0})
member.summary: Reads a value from the cache. If the value is not found, it will be created using the and then added to the cache. If no factory is specified, a null value is returned if the item is not already in the cache.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.ICache`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Ensures that an item has been removed from the cache.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.ICache`2.Reset
member.summary: Removes all items from the cache.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.MultiThreadedCache`2
member.summary: A thread-safe implementation. Multiple readers will not block one another. Write operations will block all readers and writers until completed. will gracefully clear the cache.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.MultiThreadedCache`2.GetOrAdd(`0,VC3.ComponentModel.FactoryMethod{`1,`0})
member.summary: Reads a value from the cache. If the value is not found, it will be created using the and then added to the cache. If no factory is specified, a null value is returned if the item is not already in the cache. This method is thread safe and allows for concurrent cache reads. Keys will only be added to the cache exactly once (unless they are removed with or ).

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.MultiThreadedCache`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes an item from the cache

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.MultiThreadedCache`2.Reset
member.summary: Removes all items from the cache. This operation is only visible to the current thread and future ones, or when in a web application, the current request and future requests.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.SingleThreadedCache`2
member.summary: A kind of cache that assumes only one thread of execution will access it at a time. This assumption means that there is no locking overhead for cache read and write operations.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.PerThreadCache`2
member.summary: A thread-safe ICache implementation. A seperate copy of the cache is kept per thread (or per request if in a web application).

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PerThreadCache`2.GetOrAdd(`0,VC3.ComponentModel.FactoryMethod{`1,`0})
member.summary: Reads a value from the cache. If the value is not found, it will be created using the and then added to the cache. If no factory is specified, a null value is returned if the item is not already in the cache. This method is thread safe and allows for concurrent cache reads. Keys will only be added to the cache exactly once (unless they are removed with or ).

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PerThreadCache`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes an item from the cache

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PerThreadCache`2.Reset
member.summary: Removes all items from the cache. This operation is only visible to the current thread and future ones, or when in a web application, the current request and future requests.

member.name: T:VC3.Collections.FixedStringDictionary
member.summary: This class extends the functionality of the by allowing users to modify values associated with keys that are already in the dictionary. The keys themselves, however, cannot be modifed, added, or deleted.
member.remarks: Classes that inherit the abstract class should maintain the collection of items in the dictionary using the protected Add, Remove, SetItem, and Clear methods. Using the SetItem method rather than the default indexer to set items guarantees that an undefined key will not raise an error but will, instead, automatically create a new dictionary entry.

member.name: T:VC3.Collections.SafeStringDictionary
member.summary: Provides read-only access to a object.
member.remarks: Classes that inherit the abstract class should maintain the collection of items in the dictionary using the protected Add, Remove, SetItem, and Clear methods.

member.name: P:VC3.Collections.SecureStringDictionary.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key.
member.value: The value associated with the specified key. If the specified key is not found, Get returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), and Set creates a new entry with the specified key.
member.remarks: If the entry you are referencing is encrypted, Get will automatically decrypt the entry and return the unencrypted result, while Set will overwrite the encrypted entry with the unencrypted value.

member.name: P:VC3.Collections.SecureStringDictionary.Item(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: (Write-Only) Sets the value associated with the specified key, and allows the user to encrypt specific entries as they are added or modified.
member.value: The value associated with the specified key. If the specified key is not found, Set creates a new entry with the specified key.
member.remarks: If the entry you are referencing is encrypted, Set will overwrite the encrypted entry with the unencrypted value unless the encrypt parameter is set to true, in which case the value will be encrypted before being saved into the dictionary.

member.name: M:VC3.Util.ObjectCloner.Clone(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones an object using and then optionally clones each field
member.remarks:
Each field will also be cloned if fields is true. In this case the following procedure is used to clone each field:
If the field's value is null, it's cloned value will be null.
If the field has a attached to it then will be called to clone the field.
Otherwise, if the field's runtime type has a attached to it then will be called to clone the field.
member.param: Object to clone

If true, each field will be cloned based on their . Also, if field is a reference type it will be set to the cloned version of its original reference. If false, a simple memberwise clone will be created.
member.returns: A clone of the specified object

member.summary: Updates all fields of a cloned object so that they refer to the cloned version of the objects the currently reference.

member.name: T:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator
member.summary: Utility for generating random passwords
member.remarks:
The RandomPasswordGenerator class provides functionality for generating random passwords. The caller can specify minimum length and maximum length as well as allowed characters. The allowed characters are grouped into four distinct groups: the lowercase character group, the uppercase character group, the numeric character group, and the special character group. By default, the groups are defined as follows: Character GroupInitial Definition
LowerCaseabcdefgijkmnopqrstwxyz
UpperCaseABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRSTWXYZ
Numeric23456789
Special%2A%24%2D%2B%3F%5F%26%3D%21%25%7B%7D%2F Note that there are some characters missing from the default character groups for the sake of clarity. It is often difficult to discern the numeral '1' from the lowercase 'l', particularly when dealing with an unfamiliar generated password, so potentially confusing characters have been left out of the default sets.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.SetLowerCaseCharacterGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the lowercase character group.
member.param: The string of lowercase characters that makes up the character group.
member.exception: Thrown when the input string contains non-lowercase characters.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.RevertLowerCaseCharacterGroup
member.summary: Reverts the lowercase character group back to it's original values.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.SetUpperCaseCharacterGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the uppercase character group.
member.param: The string of uppercase characters that makes up the character group.
member.exception: Thrown when the input string contains non-uppercase characters.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.RevertUpperCaseCharacterGroup
member.summary: Reverts the uppercase character group back to it's original values.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.SetNumericCharacterGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the numeric character group.
member.param: The string of numeric characters that makes up the character group.
member.exception: Thrown when the input string contains non-numeric characters.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.RevertNumericCharacterGroup
member.summary: Reverts the numeric character group back to it's original values.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.SetSpecialCharacterGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the special character group.
member.remarks: The special character group is designed to embody all of the characters not included in the LowerCase,UpperCase, or Numeric character groups. Although by default the group only includes a small subset of the available characters, any valid value that is not numeric or alphabetic can be included in the special character group. One interesting possibility relevant in scenarios where the password is used to supply credentials electronically and the password will never need to be typed interactively by a user is the ability to include untypeable control characters (like ESC) in the password.
member.param: The string of special characters that makes up the character group.
member.exception: Thrown when the input string contains numeric, lowercase, or uppercase characters.

member.name: M:VC3.Security.Util.RandomPasswordGenerator.RevertSpecialCharacterGroup
member.summary: Reverts the special character group back to it's original values.

The maximum length of the generated password.
member.returns: A random password.

member.summary: Generates a random password using the minimum length, maximum length, and enumeration specified in the method parameters.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObjectList.OwnerPersister
member.summary: Handles lists that are being used to maintain a relationship between the list owner and item in the list where the items in the list are "owned" by the list owner and cannot exist without being owned.

remarks.para: An example of this type of relationship might be an Account's assocition with AccountNote. AccountNote cannot exist without being associated with an Account. By using this form of list management, AccountNotes can be deleted from the system simply by removing them from the AccountNotesList owned by an Account. Likewise, an AccountNote can be associated with an Account by addinging it to an Account's Notes collection.
This class works in conjunction with the and attributes.

member.summary: Called after each item in the list is committed. Invokes the "update" delegate passing the list owner and current list of list item ids.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObjectList.AddRemovePersister
member.summary: Tracks a list of added and removed objects and allows for two delegates, an "adder" and a "remover" to handle persisting the changes.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObjectList.AddRemovePersister.OnBeforeCommit
member.summary: Called by BEFORE each item in the list is commited. Calls the "remover" delegate that was specified during list registration passing to it the list owner and list of REMOVED item ids.
member.remarks: Deletes must be performed before inserts to prevent primary key violations. Because of this, deletes will performed first, followed by CommitChanges on each list item, followed by inserts ().

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObjectList.AddRemovePersister.OnAfterCommit
member.summary: Called by AFTER each item in the list is commited. Calls the "adder" delegate that was specified during list registration passing to it the list owner and list of ADDED item ids.
member.remarks: Deletes must be performed before inserts to prevent primary key violations. Because of this, deletes () will performed first, followed by CommitChanges on each list item, followed by inserts.

member.param: Indicates whether the property should be automaticall audited

member.summary: Indicates whether the BeforePropertySet event should be audited for the class or property.

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.AuditedAttribute.Children
member.summary: Indicates whether changes to child or properties should be audited for the class or property.

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.AuditedAttribute.ShowValues
member.summary: Indicates whether audited changes to child or properties should include values.

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.AuditedAttribute.HiddenPropertyValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that should be used for auditing when the property's actual value is hidden.

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.AuditedAttribute.AutoAudit
member.summary: Indicates whether the and auditing settings should be automatically determined by implementations, or if the values for these settings on the current attribute should be used.
member.remarks:
The following logic will be used when automatically determining auditing settings:
if child is BusinessObject if child has audited properties if has auditor attribute PropertySet = true Children = false else PropertySet = false Children = true else PropertySet = true Children = false
else if child is BusinessObjectList PropertySet = false if list has add/remove persist manager Children = true else Children = false
else PropertySet = true Children = false

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.TransactedActivity
member.summary: Represents a set of transacted actions.
member.remarks: The transaction is automatically started when the object is created. Call to commit the transaction. If is not called before is called, Dispose will rollback the transaction.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.TransactedActivity.#ctor(VC3.ComponentModel.ITransactionProvider)
member.summary: Begins a new transaction using the specified transaction provider.
member.param: The transaction provider

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.TransactedActivity.Complete
member.summary: Commits the transaction. Will throw an exception if the transaction has already been committed or rolled back.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.TransactedActivity.Abort
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction. Will throw an exception if the transaction has already been committed or rolled back.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.TransactedActivity.Dispose
member.summary: Aborts the transaction if it has not already been committed or rolled back.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.TransactedActivity.StepComplete
member.summary: Completes the current transaction and begins a new one. Will throw an exception if the transaction has already been committed or rolled back.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity
member.summary: Represents a set of two or more composite actions.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity.#ctor(VC3.ComponentModel.IActivity[])
member.summary: Combines two or more activities into a single composite activity.
member.param: An array of two or more activities to combine

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity.Complete
member.summary: Completes the activities in reverse order to ensure that inner activities are completed before outer activities.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the activities in reverse order to ensure that inner activities are aborted before outer activities.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes all activities in reverse order to ensure that inner activities are disposed before outer activities.
member.remarks: If an exception occurs when one or more of the activities are being disposed, the first exception while be stored and rethrown after all activities have been disposed to ensure that resources are not lost.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.UndoableAction
member.summary: Implementation of IDisposible that invokes a delegate when the object is disposed.

member.name: E:VC3.ComponentModel.ITransactionProvider.AfterBegin

member.name: E:VC3.ComponentModel.ITransactionProvider.AfterCommit

member.name: E:VC3.ComponentModel.ITransactionProvider.AfterRollback
member.summary: Raised after the root transaction has been rolled back. Event handlers are automatically unregistered after the transaction is completed.

member.summary: Raised after the root transaction has been committed.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.EditGlobalScopeIntention
member.summary: Notifies the component model that the current thread intends to edit objects that are in . Once this intention has been specified, all loading and editing activities involving objects in global scope will be temporarily isolated just to the current thread. If a global object is changed AND committed, then the shared global scope will be refreshed for the current thread, any future threads, or, if in a web app, any future web requests. Note: Dispose of the object once the editing is completed to revert.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.EditGlobalScopeIntention.#ctor
member.summary: Notifies the component model that the current thread intends to edit objects that are in . Once this intention has been specified, all loading and editing activities involving objects in global scope will be temporarily isolated just to the current thread. If a global object is changed AND committed, then the shared global scope will be refreshed for the current thread, any future threads, or, if in a web app, any future web requests. Note: Dispose of the object once the editing is completed to revert.

member.summary: Used to access a named value from the scope. Set to null to remove the item from this scope

member.summary: Used to synchronize access to objects within the scope

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.ScopeBase
member.summary: Base class to simplify scope implementations

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.ResetableScope`1
member.summary: A type of that will gracefully reset its state. When is called, all instances of this scope will be reset to their original state for all future threads or web requests. All current threads or web requests however will be unaffected except for the thread that called .

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.ResetableScope`1.ResetAll
member.summary: Resets all scope instances of this type. All instances of this scope will be reset to their original state for all future threads or web requests. All current threads or web requests however will be unaffected except for the thread that called .

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.ThreadScope
member.summary: Used to scope objects to a single, logical thread. If there is a web request executing, then is used for storage and the scope will be reset at the end of the web request.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.GlobalScope
member.summary: Used to scope objects to an a scope that is shared across threads. Objects in this scope change infrequently and can only be edited when a is in effect.

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.GlobalScope.GlobalLocker
member.summary: Use a shared lock for GlobalScope and ReadOnlyScope

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.ReadOnlyScope
member.summary: Used to scope objects to an a scope that is shared across threads. Objects in this scope cannot be edited. Ever.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint
member.summary: Provides hints to object loaders in order to optimize the loading process.

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint.SingularLoading
member.summary: = 1 and assumes that all types will be loadable.

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint.Defaults
member.summary: Don't use any special hints. Use default batch size and assumes that all types will be loadable.

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint.maxBatchSize
member.summary: 0 means defaults will be used

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Suggests that loading should be optimized by reading ahead in batches of up to . Assumes that all types will have full data available and are loadable.
member.param: Maximum size of read-ahead batch

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint.#ctor(System.Type[])
member.summary: Assumes that full data is available only for a specific set of types. In this mode, the database can return the id, and typeid if InheritanceScheme is being used, of all objects but will only be called for objects of the type specified. Data for list associations must also include the parent object's id. This allows full initialization to be deferred and delegated to type-specific stored procedures using "item loading".
member.param: The list of types that the loader will assume have full data and can be initialized. If no types are specified, no objects will be initialized.

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint.MaxBatchSize
member.summary: Maximum number of items to load when doing batched loading. 0 means that the default value will be used.

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.LoadingHint.LoadableTypes
member.summary: The list of types that can be loaded

member.summary: Loads the specified .

member.param: Object to load

member.summary: Loads the specified object and any other objects with the same id already registered.

member.summary: Used to notify the loader that the specified object has not yet been loaded but is a candidate for being loaded. The object may be loaded now or later.
member.param: The loadable .

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.BatchedLoader
member.summary: Responsible for on-demand batch loading of unintialized objects. Provides read-ahead optimization to load all uninitialized objects registered with the loader when the first one calls .

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.BatchedLoader.MultiRegInitialCapacity
member.summary: The number of items with the same Id that are expected to be registered at the same time. Making this smaller will save some memory but as soon as the number of items registered at the same id gets larger than this, there will be a hit for the list to resize itself.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.BatchedLoader.Register(VC3.ComponentModel.BusinessObject)

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.TypeInferredFactory.CreateIdentifier(System.Type,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an identifier from an array of values that includes id and type information.
member.para: The array should be in the form: { idValue+ [, typeId] } Where idValue should be the untyped id values and typeId is an optional type id. If a typeId is included, it will be used to infer the objectType to use. If a typeId is not included and objectType has no sub classes then the factory doesn't need to use typeId but will instead simply use the objectType. If the type cannot be identified a that is is returned. This id can still be used to comparisons with other ids however passing it into CreateBusinessObject will result in an exception.
member.returns: A new identifier

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.TypeIdAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute can be used in two ways:
1) When applied to a property, this attribute indicates that the value of the property will used to determine the of object to create when loading data.
2) When applied to a class, this value specified in the constructor will be compared to the value of the property in (1). If no value is specified, then it is treated as a default case which is useful for mapping a type in a "wildcard" fashion. If multiple classes use wildcards the most specific class will win. This enables for some framework classes to be customized per application by subclassing and adding a TypeId() attribute.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.InheritanceSchemeAttribute
member.summary: Creates an that manages a family of classes, related by inheritance. When applied to a class, that class (the root class) and all derived classes are managed by a single . Each class in the family can be configured independently using , , and attributes however only the applied to the root class or its subclasses will be used.

remarks.para: You should use this attribute to enable inheritance in your classes. To support inheritance, you must specify how types are infered from data by implementing a .

The family of classes managed by this scheme must meet the following requirements: -All concrete classes must have the same id structure -All objects must have a unique identity throughout the entire family

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.ThreadLocal`1
member.summary:
Provides one storage location per executing thread. If the storage is accessed in the context of a web request the is used for the backing store and the will be released after the completion of the web request. If there is no web request, then thread static storage (implemented with the ) will be used.
Never use [ThreadStatic] inside of a web request.
More Info: ThreadStatic, CallContext and HttpContext in ASP.Net http://piers7.blogspot.com/2005/11/threadstatic-callcontext-and_02.html

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.ThreadLocal`1.GetStorage
member.summary: The dictionary holding references, one per instanciated ThreadLocalReference type

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.RepeatableReadReference`1
member.summary: A kind of ThreadLocalReference that ensures that a thread will always read the same value, regardless of changes made to it by other threads. New threads/requests will see the last value that was written by any other thread/request. In other words, this is a globally scoped object that will gracefully propagate changes to other threads.
member.typeparam: Type of value to store

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.RepeatableReadReference`1.Forget(`0)
member.summary: Forces the current thread to forget the last value returned by the property. The value of the parameter will be returned by the property the next time it is read by any thread that has called Forget() since it's last read.
member.param: Value of the property to return the next time it is read by any thread that has called Forget()

member.name: P:VC3.ComponentModel.RepeatableReadReference`1.Object
member.summary: The stored object. The current thread will always read the same value unless the value is changed by the current thread. New threads will read the last written value.

member.summary: An IReference with a single backing field as storage

member.name: M:VC3.Diagnostics.Notifier.NotifyAll(System.Exception,VC3.ComponentModel.License,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Delivers event to all notifiers. Error exception info and the web request info (if any) will be available for use in the notification template. The specified custom template values will also be available.

remarks.para: Notification templates can include parameters that will contain specific values when an event occurs. Templates are evaluated by the .

The following template parameters can be included in the notification template:
Name Description
Exception.Exists True/False. Indicates that an exception is associated with this notification.
Exception.Type If an exception occured, full class name of the base exception
Exception.StackTrace If an exception occured, complete stack trace
Exception.Message If an exception occured, the error message of the base exception
Exception.ShortMessage If an exception occured, the first line of the error message of the base exception
User.Description
Description of the current user (the return value of .ToString())
Web.Exists True/False depending of if the notification occured during a web request. If "True" the additional web-related parameters will be available.
Web.Url The requested Url
Web.RefererUrl The refering url, if any
Web.ServerAddress IP address of the web server
Web.ServerName Server name taken from the "Host" header.
Web.UserHostAddress IP address of the client machine that made the web request
Web.UserHostName Resolved IP address of the client machine that made the web request
Web.Browser User agent that make the web request
Web.Cookies Cookies, if any, sent with the web request
Web.RequestMethod The HTTP request method (GET, POST, etc)
Web.Header[HeaderName] Value of the HeaderName HTTP header sent from the client
Web.IsClientConnected True if the client is still connected to the web server.
Assembly[AssemblyName].Version Version number for assembly "VersionName". Example: Assembly[VC3.Web].Version}. Available for any loaded assembly.

member.param: The error to process
The current application license use to identify the application environment
Custom template values

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.EnforcementMode
member.summary: Enumeration identifying the three modes under which property preconditions may be enforced.

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.EnforcementMode.PropertySet
member.summary: Mode indicating that the precondition enforcement is occurring during a property set operation. Useful when the preconditions must alter the value or prevent the property from being set to enforce business rules.

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.EnforcementMode.PropertyCheck
member.summary: Mode indicating that a value is being statically checked against the preconditions of a property. The object instance will not be available, so only static preconditions should be enforced.

member.name: F:VC3.ComponentModel.EnforcementMode.Object
member.summary: Mode indicating that the entire object is being validated in preparation for committing changes to the object in some way. This mode enables cross-property validation to occur by ensuring that all properties of an object are enforced at the same time.

member.name: T:VC3.ComponentModel.PropertyPreconditions
member.summary: Represents a collection of PreconditionAttribute subclasses and enables the retrieval and enforcement of these property preconditions.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PropertyPreconditions.Enforce(System.Object,System.Object,VC3.ComponentModel.EnforcementMode)
member.summary: Determines if all of the preconditions were met.
member.param: The instance to enforce preconditions on.
The value to test.
The enforcement mode: Object, ProperyCheck, or PropertySet.
member.returns: The validated value. This may be different than the value parameter because a precondition can change a value in order to make it valid.
member.exception: Thrown when the value did not pass 1 or more precondition tests.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PropertyPreconditions.GetPreconditions(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Gets preconditions for the specified property.
member.param: The instance containing the property.
The name of the property.
member.returns: A PropertyPrecondition instance.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PropertyPreconditions.GetPreconditions(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Gets preconditions for the specified property.
member.param: The type containing the property.
The name of the property.
member.returns: A PropertyPrecondition instance.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PropertyPreconditions.Enforce(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if all static preconditions were met for the specified property.
member.param: The object instance.
The name of the property.
The value to test.
member.returns: The validated value. This may be different than the value parameter because a precondition can change a value in order to make it valid.
member.remarks: Only static preconditions are enforced by this method. Preconditions requiring object instances, such as comparison conditions, are ignored.
member.exception: Thrown when the value did not pass 1 or more precondition tests.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PropertyPreconditions.Enforce(System.Type,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if all static preconditions were met for the specified property.
member.param: The type of the object.
The name of the property.
The value to test.
member.returns: The validated value. This may be different than the value parameter because a precondition can change a value in order to make it valid.
member.remarks: Only static preconditions are enforced by this method. Preconditions requiring object instances, such as comparison conditions, are ignored.
member.exception: Thrown when the value did not pass 1 or more precondition tests.

member.name: M:VC3.ComponentModel.PropertyPreconditions.Enforce(System.Object)
member.summary: Enforces all preconditions for all properties on the specified object.
member.param: The object instance.
member.exception: Thrown when a property does not pass one or more precondition tests.

member.summary: Returns the precondition at the specified index.

member.name: T:VC3.Net.Mail
member.summary: Simple class for sending mail through an Smtp Server. will come from.
member.remarks: This class assumes that if the Smtp Server field is not supplied before a call to SendEmail is called that the configuration is stored in the app.config file. The configuration keys are expected to be in the AppConfig node. The supported keys are : 1. "SmtpMail.SmtpServer" = The address:port of the Smtp Server to forward Emails to for sending. If port not specified, default port 25 is used. 2. "SmtpMail.DebugMailTo" = a valid address to override the To: address of all emails with. If this value is set in the app.config then all emails will be sent to this address instead of the normally expected address. 3. "SmtpMail.Encoding" = the encoding type for all email messages. If not set, then the type defaults to Encoding.ASCII. 4. "SmtpMail.BodyFormat" = the body format for all email messages. If not set, then the format defaults to MailFormat.Text. 5. "SmtpMail.FromAddress" = value overrides the from address passed in to the SendMail function.

member.summary: Sets a new current word for the instance, computing the new word's metaphone keys
member.param: New word to set to current word. Discards previous metaphone keys, and computes new keys for this word

members.member: Internal impl of double metaphone algorithm. Populates m_primaryKey and m_alternateKey. Modified copy-past of Phillips' original code

Appends a metaphone character to the primary, and a possibly different alternate, metaphone keys for the word.
@param primaryCharacter Primary character to append to primary key, and, if no alternate char is present, the alternate key as well @param alternateCharacter Alternate character to append to alternate key. May be null or a zero-length string, in which case the primary character will be appended to the alternate key instead

member.name: M:VC3.Data.Datasource.LockConnection(System.Data.IDbConnection)

member.name: F:VC3.Data.SqlDatasourceAdapter.UniqueIndexViolationError
member.summary: This error occurs when you attempt to put duplicate index values into a column or columns that have a unique index. Microsoft SQL Server does not allow two rows to have the same index value (including NULL) in columns that have a unique index. SQL Server checks for duplicate values when the index is created and each time the table is modified using the INSERT or UPDATE statement.
